item.title: Single Point Sensor Systems Main Tanks 2 and 3 Sensors (Reserve Transfer) – Reserve Tanks Fueled

remarks.para: May be inoperative with reserve tanks 2 and 3 fueled provided:

numlitem.para: Main tanks 2 and 3 fuel quantity indicating systems are operative,
Zero Fuel Weight CG limit is 4% MAC forward of the Aft Limit, and
If fuel in reserve tanks 2 or 3 does not transfer, observe 325 KCAS/0.92M speed limitation for remainder of flight.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: When operating with both transfer sensors inoperative, an additional failure may occur en route which causes fuel not to transfer from the reserve tanks. Flight crew must therefore:
Plan required fuel load considering that fuel may become trapped in reserve tank(s).

Ensure reserve tank fuel automatically transfers when either Main Tank 2 or 3 quantity is reduced below 40,000 lbs. This is necessary since EICAS annunciation may not occur after subsequent failure en route.
If fuel in reserve tank(s) does not transfer, limit Vmo/Mmo to 325 KCAS/.92 Mach for the remainder of the flight.

note.para: Lateral imbalance due to one reserve tank full and one reserve tank empty is less than the max lateral imbalance allowable in the Weight and Balance Manual.

numlitem.para: Aircraft is to be loaded so that the actual ZFW CG is at least 4% MAC forward of the aft limit.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "#2 OR #3 MAIN TANK SINGLE PT SENSORS SYS INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
